comments:
Hello,

    Recently we have upgraded to Birt 2.2 so we can support WebSphere 6.1.  When the Report Engine is initialized the UI for configuring Application Security -> Role Mappings is no longer available in the WebSphere Integrated Solutions Console, when I try to view the Enterprise Application configuration for our WebApp, the stacktrace below is produced. I've verified this against the BirtViewer WebApp included with the Birt 2.2 runtime package (by adding role based security to the war).

Has anyone else tried this scenario? I've tried all of the previous suggestions in regards to using Birt with WebSphere (ClassLoader order etc) and none change the result.

Thanks,

Matt.

P.S.

    When you install the application (with role based security), and before you start the application (or initialize the Report Engine) you will see  [Security role to user/group mapping] as a link in the Enterprise Application configuration.  Also, if you take a screen cap of this UI before you start the application (or initialize the Report Engine) you will see that there are many options that will no longer be available.

==========================================================================================================

do you assign enough permission for BIRT?

see 182161.

This doesn't seem to be an issue with JAAS.  Our application works with WebLogic, JBoss, Jetty & Tomcat.  WebSphere 6.1 is the only one that has this issue, and it only affects WebSphere's Integrated Solutions Console (UI).  Also, our application does not load Birt from the WAR, it loads from an independent ClassLoader outside of the WebApp, requests to the Report Engine servlet are proxied to it. This seems to be an issue with OSGi/emf (?) conflicting with the one used by WebSphere.

Matt.
Can you describe the system structure here? Thanks.

Windows Server 2003
4x 2.8GHz Xeon
3GB RAM
IBM WebSphere 6.1 (using IBM jdk packaged w/ WebSphere)
Oracle 10g

We are getting the same error but without security enabled.  We have RAD 7.0.0.3 + BIRT 2.2.1 (packaged in our own WAR/EAR) + WAS 6.1.0.2 profile.  When we deploy the EAR containing the BIRT WAR we get this same error.  If we remove the EAR from WAS, the WAS admin console works perfectly again.  Deploying the EAR a 2nd time, reintroduces the error.

traces.message: schema_reference.4: Failed to read schema document 'bundleresource://25/application_1_4.xsd', because 1) could not find the document; 2) the document could not be read; 3) the root element of the document is not <xsd:schema>.
